options.label: Smoking on the hood of your car, thinking about how gas fees ruined your life. ●
Flexing in front of a mirror while explaining why decentralization is the future... to yourself. ●
Attending a “networking” event for the free cocktails and soft lighting for selfies. ●
Pretending to be busy so no one asks you to hang out. ●
Plotting world domination while quoting Kanye. Loudly. ●
Cracking open a cold one & making a DAO to govern the spotify playlist for your house party.

questions.prompt: Someone calls your favourite NFT a scam. What do you do? ●

options.label: Send them a “gm” DM laced with your mom jokes. ●
Laugh awkwardly, then hit them with “you don’t get it, bruh.” ●
Photoshop your PFP onto a $10 bill and tweet, “Stay mad, broke boi.” ●
Ghost them so hard they start questioning their existence. ●
Hire a bot army to follow them so X bans their account. ●
Start a Twitter Space titled “How to Spot an NPC IRL” and tag them.
Finding out your wallet got rugged while you were taking a nap. ●
People figuring out you don’t actually read whitepapers. ●
Losing an argument on Crypto Twitter. In public. ●
Running out of snacks and emotional bandwidth simultaneously. ●
Someone’s already using your AGW username. ●
Posting a leak in the wrong group chat... and accidentally doxxing myself.

questions.prompt: You just won the lottery. What’s your first move? ●

options.label: Buy a Lambo and tweet “Not financial advice.” ●
Launch a new token called $BDE —Big Dawg Energy. ●
Hire someone to carry your snacks so you can “focus on strategy.” ●
Buy an island but forget to tell anyone because you hate social interaction. ●
Make a feature film about your life called “The Wolf of Rug Street.” ●
Buy out an entire chain of coffee shops and rename it Degen Café.
Self-aware mess. 60% genius, 40% chaos, 100% can’t be bothered. ●
Alpha energy wrapped in a protein shake. You’re the Dawg of the gym and the chain. ●
Stylish, sharp, and always ready to dunk on someone’s bad taste. ●
Quiet menace. Your silence is louder than any bull market hype. ●
Dramatic AF but in a way people find oddly endearing. You’re the main character. ●
Villain arc meets genius. You’re not here to play; you’re here to own.

questions.prompt: What’s your go-to excuse for being late to a meeting? ●

options.label: “Gas fees were too high. I had to wait for the dip.” ●
“Sorry, I was hitting the gym. You can’t flex utility without actual flexes.” ●
“Got stuck in traffic... on Discord.” ●
“I wasn’t late; you were just early. Time is a construct.” ●
“My Wi-Fi rug-pulled me mid-mint.” ●
“I was onboarding someone, aka convincing them I’m not in a cult.”

questions.prompt: What’s the first thing you do after waking up? ●

options.label: Check if ETH is up, down, or emotionally unstable. ●
Post a gym selfie captioned “Rise & Grind, Degens.” ●
Scroll Twitter for alpha leaks while sipping overpriced cold brew. ●
Stare at the ceiling, wondering why you agreed to exist today. ●
Announce a DAO proposal in your group chat just to cause chaos. ●
Open your AGW, even though you know your holdings are still wrecked.

questions.prompt: What’s your response to someone saying “Web3 is dead”? ●

options.label: “Nah, it’s just sleeping. Like me during every bull market.” ●
“Funny, that’s what they said about Bitcoin in 2017.” ●
“Dead? You mean thriving, but okay, Boomer.” ●
[leaves convo without explanation] ●
“Web3 isn’t dead; it just rugged you. ” ●
“Tell me you don’t own NFTs without telling me.”

questions.prompt: Your wallet gets hacked. What’s your coping mechanism? ●

options.label: Tweet “brb crying” while secretly planning revenge. ●
Bench press the pain away. Wallet drained, but you still have gains. ●
Photoshop a new PFP and call it “community-owned.” ●
Shrug it off because you only keep the good stuff in cold storage. ●
Host a Space titled “How to Recover From Rugging Yourself.” ●
Keep annoying ZachXBT on X.
I minted my PFP at 0.05 ETH. You bought it at 5 ETH. ●
I can name five Layer 1 blockchains and lift all of them. ●
My PFP is more fashionable than your entire wardrobe. ●
I’ve never FOMO’d. Not once. Not even in high school. ●
I’ve flipped more haters than actual projects. ●
I sold at the top and still complain about not selling earlier.
